contentrichtext.text: '''Operation Garron''' is the codename that the [[United Kingdom]] has assigned to its [[military]] [[Humanitarian aid|relief]] operation in the aftermath of the devastating [[tsunami]] caused by the [[2004 Indian Ocean earthquake]]. ==Initial response== The first forces assigned were [[Royal Navy]] and [[Royal Air Force]]. An RAF [[C-17 Globemaster III]] [[Cargo aircraft|transport aircraft]] was assigned to the region along with the RN [[warship]] [[HMS Chatham (F87)|HMS ''Chatham'']], which left its station patrolling in the [[Persian Gulf]]. The [[Royal Fleet Auxiliary]] [[Ship|vessel]] [[RFA Diligence|RFA ''Diligence'']], present in [[Kochi, India|Kochi]], [[India]] when the disaster struck, replenished ''Chatham'' before returning to Kochi to embark aid supplies. Royal Navy [[engineer]]s were also airlifted to the area to augment the ''Diligence''. After the port call it returned to the [[disaster]] area, to perform relief work with ''Chatham'' around the east [[coast]] of [[Sri Lanka]]. The embarked [[helicopter]]s on board the ships, including two [[Westland Lynx]] machines on board ''Chatham'', are also participating in the relief effort. Further RAF Globemaster, [[Lockheed L-1011|Tristar]] and [[C-130 Hercules|Hercules]] aircraft have flown in supplies. RAF personnel are operating in the city of [[Banda Aceh]], [[Indonesia]] in assistance of RAF and international relief flights there. ==Troop offer== A [[Company (military unit)|company]] of a [[British Army]] [[Gurkha]] battalion stationed in [[Brunei]] and two accompying [[Army Air Corps (United Kingdom)|Army Air Corps]] helicopters was offered to the Indonesian [[government]] in January 2005 to aid in efforts on the island of [[Sumatra]]. However, Indonesia declined the Gurkha troops, and accepted only the helicopters. ==External links== *[http://www.operations.mod.uk/garron/ Official Ministry of Defence operation webpage] *[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/4147619.stm Gurkha aid offer 'not necessary' BBC News] [[Category:2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami]]
